July 30
1962
Alec Sutherland
Director
University of Chicago
Chicago 37, Illinois
Dear Alec;
I have just returned from an extended business-
vacation TRIP TO THE FAR WEST. I FOUND YOUR LETTER OF
June 28th among the others awaiting my returs. I am
HASTENING TO ANSWER IT BECAUSE OF THE IMPORTANCE OF
THE SUGGESTION YOU HAVE MADE. YOU HAVE CERTAINLY PUT
YOUR FINGER ON THE VERY VITAL AREA IN EDUCATIONAL
BROADCASTING TODAY. I SUPPOSE THAT THIS PROBLEM IS
SHARED BY ALL VOLUNTARY ASSOCIATIONS. CERTAINLY IT
HAS PLAGUEO NAEB FOR MANY YEARS. SlMPLY STATED, IT IS
HOW DO WE MAKE PRACTICING DEMOCRACY WORK AT THIS LEVEL
AHD HOW ARE WE CERTAIN THAT ELECTED REPRESENTATIVES
ALWAYS UNDERSTAND THE WISHED OF THOSE WHO ELECTED THEM,
AND REFLECT THESE WISHES IN THEIR ACTIONS WITH THE
GROUP.
As YOU KNOW NAEB HAS TRIED THROUGH THE YEARS
THROUGH NATIONAL PANELS AND GROUP D I SCUSSI0N8 AT THE
IERT AND THROUGH THE GENERAL MEETINGS, AS WELL AS
THROUGH SEMINARS AND WORKSHOPS AND OTHER AFFAIRS TO
ADEQUATELY AND ACCURATELY REFLECT THE THINKING OF ITS
MEMBERS. IN SOME INSTANCES THIS HAS WORKED, AND WORKED
WELL. IN OTHERS IT HAS BEEN WHOLLY INADEQUATE. I
THINK THE FACT THAT NAEB HAS PROSPERED AND GROWN IS
SOME INDICATION THAT IT HAS BEEN ON THE RIGHT SIDE MORE
TIMES THAN ON THE WRONG ONE.
Discussions regarding the programming of the
NAEB RADIO NETWORK AND THE DECISION RECENTLY ARRIVED
AT TO DO SOME EXPERIMENTAL WORK IN TV PRODUCTIONS HAVE
BEEN THE RESULT OF MANY YEARS OF SOLID DISCUSSION. I
BELIEVE THESE DECISIONS ARE NOW SOUND WITHIN THE FRAMEÂ¬
WORK WE HAVE ESTABLISHED. As YOU ARE WELL AWARE THERE
ARE CERTAIN LIMITATIONS OF DOLLARS AND TIME INVOLVED
HERE AND MANY OF THE THINGS WE WOULD LIKED TO HAVE DONE
IN NAEB HAVE BEEN IMPOSSIBLE BECAUSE OF ONE OR THE
OTHER OF THESE LIMITATIONS.
